edu.stanford.math.plex_plus.homology.simplex_streams
Class MaximalStream

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.plex_plus.homology.simplex_streams.MaximalStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimplexStream<Simplex>, java.lang.Iterable<Simplex>
Direct Known Subclasses:
VietorisRipsStream
public abstract class MaximalStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimplexStream<Simplex>

This class implements a simplex stream with the property that given its 1-skeleton, its higher skeletons are maximal in the following sense. A k-simplex [v_0, ..., v_k] is a member of the complex iff all of its edges [v_i, v_j] are in the complex. Thus such a complex is the maximal complex given its 1-skeleton. This class is abstract in that it does not provide a mechanism for constructing the 1-skeleton, and only constructs the higher order skeletons inductively. The reason is that there are different choices for definitions of the 1-skeletons, the main ones being the lazy witness complex, the Vietoris-Rips complex, and the clique complex. Thus a child class must provide the implementation of the 1-skeleton. Also note that the MaximalStream construction can be used with any finite metric space. For information on the implementation, consult the paper "Fast Construction of the Vietoris-Rips Complex", by Afra Zomorodian. This implementation uses the incremental algorithm described in the above paper.

Author:
Andrew Tausz

protected final gnu.trove.map.hash.TObjectDoubleHashMap<Simplex> filtrationValues

maxDistance - the maximum allowable distance in the complex

Method Detail

constructEdges

protected abstract UndirectedWeightedListGraph constructEdges()
This function implements the construction of the 1-skeleton. It must output a list containing pairs of filtration values and 1-simplices. The filtration value of an edge is the threshold value at which the edge appears in the filtered sequence of simplicial complexes.

Returns:
the 1-skeleton of the complex along with its filtration values

constructComplex

protected void constructComplex()

protected void incrementalExpansion(UndirectedWeightedListGraph G,
                                    int k)
This function performs the incremental expansion of the complex.

Parameters:
G - the neighborhood graph
k - the maximum dimension

addCofaces

protected void addCofaces(UndirectedWeightedListGraph G,
                          int k,
                          Simplex tau,
                          gnu.trove.set.TIntSet N,
                          double filtrationValue)
This function inductively adds all of the cofaces of the simplex tau to the complex. For more information about this algorithm, consult the paper "Fast Construction of the Vietoris-Rips Complex" by Afra Zomorodian.

Parameters:
G - the neighborhood graph
k - the maximum allowable dimension
tau - the current simplex to add
N - the lower neighbors to investigate

addSimplex

protected void addSimplex(Simplex simplex,
                          double filtrationValue)
This function simply updates the simplicial complex with a new simplex

Parameters:
simplex - the simplex to add
filtrationValue - its filtration value

finalizeStream

public void finalizeStream()
Description copied from interface: SimplexStream
This function prepares the stream for use by a consumer, such as the PersistentHomology class. After finalization, the stream must not be modified by adding or removing elements. In practice, the finalize procedure will probably do some sorting and construction of data structures necessary for iterating through the stream.

Specified by:
finalizeStream in interface SimplexStream<Simplex>

getFiltrationValue

public double getFiltrationValue(Simplex simplex)
Description copied from interface: SimplexStream
This function returns the filtration value of a simplex within a filtered simplicial complex. The filtration value is the threshold parameter at which the simplex appears within the filtration.

Specified by:
getFiltrationValue in interface SimplexStream<Simplex>
Parameters:
simplex - the simplex to query
Returns:
the filtration value of the provided simplex

true if the stream has been finalized, and false otherwise
